notes: used 'sow bear' for consistency; note: English often uses 'female bear'
English rarely gendered; Spanish/Chinese have forms
Spanish: 'águila' is feminine noun but gender marked via 'macho/hembra'
Note: Spanish 'búho' (masc) vs 'lechuza' (fem) sometimes used as gendered pair, though not biologically precise
Note: 'ballena' is feminine in Spanish but can be marked with 'macho/hembra'
